item.description:
This is the last day of Sails and Trails, a free event for Eastern Ma.  http://www.essexheritage.org/ts/events.php?sTown=-3&sDayS1=y&sDayS2=y&sDayU2=y&sTitle=&sIf=&sIh=&sIw=&sIn=&sIp=&sIs=&sIc=&sIr=&button4.x=59&button4.y=25

 

There are a few other activities in the area, but this looks like the best for Sunday.  I've climbed many lighthouses, and am looking forward to adding this one to my list!

It's an open tour, so if you are running late, we will only wait til 1 for you, but you can stand in line after we have started up.

Hospital Point Lighthouse Hosted by U. S. Coast Guard Auxiliary << add to itinerary One of Beverly's most familiar landmarks, this lighthouse commands a spectacular view of Salem Sound, and 3 other lighthouses. An enduring monument to Beverly's nautical heritage, it is one of 5 Massachusetts lighthouses that still retains its original Fresnel lens. Visitors will be guided by members of the Coast Guard Auxiliary up a winding staircase and then up a seven-step ladder to the lantern room. From there they will pass through the hatch onto the gallery balcony to enjoy the spectacular views. An earth-work fort used during the American Revolution and the War of 1812 still remains on the property. Visit Website http://www.lighthouse.cc/hospitalpoint/index.html

Sat 09-22 12:00pm-4:00pm Open Door Event.
Sun 09-30 12:00pm-4:00pm Open Door Event.

Bayview Ave
Beverly 01915

Directions: I-95 to 128N Exit 18 (Rte-22/Beverly/Essex). Turn right on Rte-22/Essex St. and travel 1 mi (over RR tracks). Turn left on Corning St (becomes Bay View Ave). Proceed straight through stop sign & Lighthouse is ahead on left. 1 mi walk from Montserrat train depot (from parking lot, turn right onto Essex St and go 1 minute walk to Corning St).
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet for the tour at the foot of the lighthouse at 1/4 of 1pm.

group.name: Meeting & Greeting in So. NH & the Merrimack Valley :)

item.name: Hospital Point Lighthouse, Beverly, MA open house
